titleStmt.title: J. M. C. McCorkle to Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7991

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Greensburg, Ky. 5 June 1863.
D. C. Wickliffe, Esq.
Secretary of State,
Sir,

My Commission as Notary Public for this county has expired. I wish it renewed. Be pleased therefore to lay this letter before his Excellency Governor Robinson, with my request, and forward it to me by return mail.

I believe the law requires me to pay a fee for the seal, a recent legislative act; but I have not been able to find it; but my recollection is it is $1.; I therefore enclose that amount. If it be more, let me know & I will promptly furnish it.

Green Co
Notary
J M. C. McCorkle
Com Issd June 10. 1863.
